title: Development of ns × nm Magnetic Imaging Technique for Current-induced Dynamics based on Ultrafast Transmission Electron Microscopy
content: Nanoscale magnetic textures, such as magnetic domain walls, bubbles, and skyrmions, are attracting significant attention for their response to external excitations (electric current, microwave, light etc.) that are potentially applicable to spintronic devices [1]. The dynamics of these magnetic textures have been investigated by Lorentz transmission electron microscopy (LTEM), where magnetic imaging before and after impulsive stimuli are performed and directly compared (so called stop-motion measurements) [2-4]. However, time-resolved measurements on ns × nm spatiotemporal scale are still challenging although it is crucial for further understanding the response of nanoscale magnetic textures to external excitations.
